Topic.Title: BAC: After $14.50, $17 comes FAST!

Message.Msg: Hi Traderdave, It is funny seeing your posts. I see why the board says you remind them on me. Well, congrats for a good trade. I am still long BAC, as I have been building a nice position on weakness. Just like you I would judge BAC on market fundamentals, but I learned that BAC does not work that way. If you remain short BAC, I am sure you will find that out as well. Though I made good money shorting BAC from 2011-2012, I have to say that I learned that BAC does not follow the market and I could have earned much more if I shorted other stocks. Out of nowhere, BAC would go on a 1 point move....I am sure you will see this. Good luck!

Message.Title: .....Margin Buying Surpasses 2007 Danger Levels – Is Another Market Crash Coming?
Message.Msg: ......Margin Buying Surpasses 2007 Danger Levels – Is Another Market Crash Coming? So it's no small matter of concern that the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority reports the amount owed on loans secured by investments climbed to a record high $384 billion at the end of April. That topped the previous high - $381 billion in 2007, not coincidentally, just before the financial meltdown and the Great Recession. As a percentage of the economy, the latest margin borrowing totaled 2.71% of gross domestic product. By comparison, margin borrowing hit 2.73% of GDP in July 2007, during the housing bubble, and 2.81% in March 2000 during the tech bubble, which was followed by a stock market crash.

Message.Title: Rotation continues into financials

Topic.Title: Average 30-year mortgage rate tops 4%

Message.Msg: It will definitely put a damper on things but it's not the end of the world. On an historical basis, we've had it good for a very long time. Mortgage rates below the 5-6% level are below the historical norm. A little bit of slowing in the housing market would also allow the infrastructure to catch up. Builders have been scrambling to find skilled workers to build the new homes. They have even been poaching each other on the job sites if the news reports are correct. This puts upward pressure on costs and can create a bubble type situation. Slowing things down a bit can help keep that from becoming a problem while giving builders a chance to catch up.

Topic.Title: You wanted a pullback ...you got it

Message.Msg: We'll see. I'm not convinced we'll see a pull back of that magnitude. I'm also not convinced that the recent "bad" economic news paints a true picture of what's going on. People are focusing far too much on individual pieces of data when they need to step back and keep the overall picture in mind. Things aren't as bad as they sound and I think people are definitely forgetting to consider the rapidly changing energy picture into their view of the future. The fact that the US is expected to be totally energy independent in as few #$%$ years has vast implications for the economy.

Topic.Title: Why are most Republicans consolidated in the old south? They used to be Democrats till civil rights was enacted .

Message.Msg: The big switch occurred after LBJ's Civil Rights Bill when the racists southerners bolted from the Democrats and formed the States' Rights Party. That failed and Nixon invited them into the Republican Party to gain power, thinking he could control them. To make a long story short, the Republicans were flooded with the #$%$ of society including the racists, the conspiracy theorists, the gold bugs, the anti-FEDs, anti-income tax, fundamentalists, the anti-Semitics, neo-Nazis, John Birchers, etc. and that is what you currently have running the Republicans. They are turning the party into a permanent minority party but using it to control their local politics. This will ensure that more social policy decisions will be made at the Federal level to override any state level bit of nonsense.

Topic.Title: Stock Market is doped and adicted to FED´QE doping program, Like Lars Armstrong

Message.Msg: What you repeatedly fail to comprehend is that stock values are the capitalization of earnings. Earnings have doubled since 2009 and the market is at 16 times this years' eps - right on the historical average. Hardly the 32 times eps bubble in 2000. Eventually, as the labor market improves the FED will withdraw liquidity and shrink the monetary base, but that does not mean policy will become restrictive, which is anethma to the market. It just means the FED is returning to a sustainable growth path for money relative to the real economy.

Topic.Title: i think there be a crash in oct like in 1987

Message.Msg: Huge difference between then and now. In 10/87 the market sold at 20 tmes eps - or a 5% earnings yield compared to long treasuries yielding over 9.6% and a prime rate of 9%. Risk premiums way out of whack between asset classes. Hence the big crash in '87. RP's are much more in line today.

Topic.Title: AIG Too Greedy

Message.Msg: We seem to be looking at different sides of the same coin. BAC position on CFC bankruptcy was a bluff and still is. If the Fed can allow them to apply over $10 Billion of capital to share buybacks and restructuring expensive long term debt without any regulatory concern think how much they could afford to pay out in this MBS settlement. $8.5 billion is nothing on $100 billion loss. They will get over it eventually but you don't want to be holding this stock this year as it moves on down back in to single figures. Successor liability has not been determined in the courts, although some rulings seem to favor the idea that BAC does have it.

Message.Title: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) said late Thursday it had closed 1st Commerce Bank of North Las Vegas
Message.Msg: Long time no see......!!! The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) said late Thursday it had closed 1st Commerce Bank of North Las Vegas, Nev. All deposits held by 1st Commerce Bank have been purchased by Irvine, Calif.-based Plaza Bank, with the deposits still covered under FDIC insurance, the government agency said.
